title: Colder weekend for North Bengal & Kolkata, mercury to dip by 2-3°Celsius
MCD steps up drain desilting after officials flag slow tendering despite Rs 36 crore allocated for 793 drains
Trump claims again that he stopped war between India, Pakistan
description: The U.S. President has claimed over 90 times that he stopped the conflict between India and Pakistan

title: ‘We’ll go with party decision’: VS Achuthanandan’s family puts ball in CPM court on accepting Padma Vibhushan
Delhi govt plans Rs 600-crore CCTV surveillance system for women safety
Two SFJ members held for painting Pro-Khalistan graffiti in Delhi
Transplanted lives: Organ donation in Kerala gains traction
description: Organ donation from live donors and harvested from brain-dead patients is often mired in controversies and misconceptions. Aathira Haridas meets some of the organ recipients and donors to understand the complex emotional and medical aspects of the life-saving process, which is slowly gaining ground in the State

title: J-K has tapped less than a quarter of its hydropower potential: Economic Survey
The Lighthouse Bar opens at The Park Visakhapatnam
description: The Lighthouse Bar at The Park returns to a familiar address in the city with quiet confidence and sharp flavours

title: No Kuki-Zo MLAs physically in House, Manipur govt passes floor test; Churachandpur sees violent protests
Across 135 exhibitors, India Art Fair in Delhi brings together modern icons, experimental practices and participatory art
Migrant hands rooted across Telangana’s farms
description: From grape farms on Hyderabad’s fringes to paddy fields deep in the countryside, Telangana’s agriculture is being sustained by workers from other States. Farmers, activists and government officials say the migrants have become indispensable to farm operations here even as local youth step away from fieldwork. K. Shiva Shanker traces the forces reshaping farm labour in the State

title: Epstein e-mails show he helped arrange White House visit for Woody Allen
Why Trump has launched the TrumpRx website to cut prescription drug prices
RBI MPC Meeting 2026 LIVE Updates: Central bank Governor to announce repo rate decision today

Cameras, biometrics, 24/7 wardens: Bihar overhauls hostel safety after NEET aspirant’s death
40 years ago February 06, 1986: Petroleum price hike reduced
From Ghaziabad tragedy, a grim reminder of the layered, complex emotional maze that is adolescence
Manoj Jha writes: My surname does not frame my politics. I am a teacher and citizen, too
To be future ready, healthcare system has to ensure quality
Being Draco Malfoy — from Harry Potter villain to China’s new year mascot
Ghaziabad minors’ suicides point to an urgent need for policy to respond to loneliness
PM frames the deal, corners Congress
Classic case of consensual relationship turning acrimonious: Supreme Court quashes FIR alleging rape
description: The bench delivered its verdict on an appeal challenging a March last year order of the Chhattisgarh High Court that had refused to quash the proceedings arising out of the FIR registered in Bilaspur district in February 2025

title: This new video series explores India’s past through food
description: Indian History, Thali by Thali, an initiative of the Historically Tempered Collective, allows experts to talk about a number of things food touches on, including gender, class, caste and hierarchies

title: High debt, DA hike, and SC directive to clear dues: Can Mamata govt afford to fulfil its promises?
‘They were busy celebrating diwali’: Punjab and Haryana High Court slams officials for ‘ignorance’ over urgent order
Indian Railways charging full fare from RAC passengers ‘not justified’, says Parliament panel; calls for partial refund
Lakshmy Ramanathan’s new novel blends romance and conservation
description: Love Bites and Pugmarks in Kabini dwells on the stormy relationship between wildlife filmmaker Dhruv Thimayya and Mira Ponappa, who runs a quaint homestay in Kabini, as well as focuses on larger conservation issues like human-animal conflict, eco-tourism and poaching

title: Trump urges new nuclear treaty after Russia agreement ends
description: The Trump administration has repeatedly pressed for a new treaty to include China, but Beijing has publicly rejected the pressure

title: Morning Digest: At least 18 killed in Meghalaya coal mine explosion; Kuki-Zo groups boycott tribal MLAs in Manipur government, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: Surjit Bhalla writes: The Budget has delivered a googly — the retrospective tax
Nirmala Sitharaman: ‘We respect him (General Naravane)… Rahul Gandhi used his name and heft to mock’
Trump administration moves to end job protections for about 50,000 federal workers
HAL to bid for licence manufacturing of 5th-gen fighter jet
FM Nirmala Sitharaman: ‘Expect funds inflow after the call between Prime Minister and (the US) President’
Libra Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: You’ll pause before spending or investing, weighing pros and cons
Sagittarius Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: Support from seniors or authorities could push your name forward for appraisal or recognition
Scorpio Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: Colleagues may leave early, but that turn works in your favour
Capricorn Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: Opportunities open up through meetings and discussions
Aquarius Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: The love front stays steady but uneventful
Pisces Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: Accept feedback calmly; your emotional balance will keep relationships steady
Aries Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: A practical, head-over-heart approach guides your money choices today
Taurus Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: You may prefer reviewing pending issues over starting anything new

Virgo Horoscope Today, 06 February 2026: You handle your budget with calm realism
SC lifts ban on Anurag Thakur from taking part in BCCI affairs
India may raise Zakir Naik issue again during PM’s Malaysia visit
description: India and Malaysia have an extradition treaty, but the case, as Malaysia maintains, will be resolved based on judicial consideration. The official said that Modi and his counterpart Anwar Ibrahim will review progress under the India-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, especially in priority areas of cooperation such as trade, investments, defence, security, semiconductors, digital technologies, renewable energy, education, healthcare, and people-to-people exchanges.

title: Marco Rubio steps down as acting head of the US National Archives
High capex to sustain growth, private investment also coming: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
Delhi Confidential: VVIP Shield
What police know so far about the abduction of Savannah Guthrie’s mother
Agreement signed for Frontier Nagaland Territorial Authority
Rajasthan: As school where 7 died starts new chapter, many others ‘unsafe’, teachers pitch in
India has ‘significant potential’ to import more agri products: US
'Border 2' : Sunny Deol starrer races past Rs 294 crore amid declining numbers
description: Despite facing fluctuations in recent collections, 'Border 2' has managed to gather an impressive Rs 294 crore within India and an outstanding Rs 402 crore worldwide. Capitalizing on the Republic Day holiday, this gripping war drama, considered a spiritual continuation of the iconic 1997 film, features the dynamic Sunny Deol and a remarkable cast.

title: Diversifying energy sourcing: MEA Jaishankar on Trump’s ‘India not to buy Russian oil’ claim
Death by cyberchondria
description: Filicide by a mother of two in Rajasthan’s Bhilwara district has shown the extremes to which health misinformation amplified by social media algorithms can lead in a country especially vulnerable to spurious medical advice

title: ‘Violation of House rules’: Congress to Om Birla on no reply by PM Modi
India’s agricultural interests fully secure under US deal: Chouhan
description: Underlining that India’s staple grains, fruits, major crops, millets and dairy products remain completely secure and face no threat whatsoever, Chouhan emphasised that the interests of small and large farmers alike have been fully protected and that the agreement will create fresh opportunities rather than risks for Indian agriculture. He said that reduced tariffs will directly benefit India’s rice, spices and textile exports, and that growth in textile exports will help millions of cotton-growing farmers.

title: Railways lowers target for passenger revenue, may earn less from freight too
description: In the freight segment, the ministry has estimated earning of around Rs 1.88 lakh crore in FY 27, same that osf BE of FY26 and 6% higher than the RE of current fiscal year. Data also show that railways is likely to end up generating around Rs 1.78 lakh crore by March, around 5.5% less than the target it had set for the current year.

title: ED arrests former Resolution Professional of Richa Industries Limited
description: The accused, identified as Arvind Kumar, worked the company’s Resolution Professional from December 2018 to June 2025

title: CPWD bought 405 air purifiers for Parliament, govt offices, SC in 4 years: Minister in Lok Sabha
'Every day can't be tukka': Rishabh Pant's explosive verdict on Abhishek Sharma
description: Rishabh Pant has identified Abhishek Sharma as cricket's most dangerous batter currently, praising his consistent, fearless approach and belief. Pant also shared insights from Rahul Dravid's advice on maintaining emotional balance, emphasizing the importance of remaining grounded whether scoring runs or failing. This perspective highlights the mental fortitude required for elite athletes.

title: Is Cooper Flagg playing tonight vs Spurs? Latest Mavericks injury update
description: Dallas Mavericks' Cooper Flagg is set to play against the San Antonio Spurs on February 5, 2026, after clearing injury checks.  With Kyrie Irving sidelined, Flagg has stepped up, averaging over 31 points recently.  His increased role and performance are crucial for the Mavericks as they face a young Spurs team led by Wembanyama and Fox.

title: Odisha proposes changes to English spelling of six districts
description: Spellings of Deogarh, Khordha, Balasore, Kendrapara, Keonjhar and Nayagarh districts are likely to be changed to Debagarh, Khoradha, Baleshwar, Kendrapada, Kendujhar and Nayagada

title: Accidents, fatalities on NHs fell 11% in 2025 as UP, MP led the way, shows data
Teacher who reached out to never-been-to-school kids honoured with $1m global prize
description: Global Teacher Prize 2026 was presented at World Governments Summit in Dubai, an annual gathering of leaders and policymakers. Now in its tenth year, the prize — an initiative of Varkey Foundation along with Unesco — honours teachers whose work reshaped learning outcomes and communities. Nagi, who has developed pedagogy around art, began her work in the slums of Mumbai about a decade ago.

title: Haryana MBBS students in dilemma over government’s bond policy; seek clarity on various aspects before consent
description: The policy to incentivise doctors to opt for government service upon completion of MBBS degree from government and government-aided medical colleges in Haryana was notified in 2022 and is applicable from academic session 2020-21 onwards

title: Several people arrested, detained at liquor party near Ahmedabad
description: The action followed a raid conducted shortly after midnight at Safal Nirvana Greens near Sanand, where a Mumbai-based man had organised a party to mark his brother-in-law’s 25th wedding anniversary, officials said

title: CPWD bought 405 air purifiers in 4 years, for babus & courts
description: In a written reply, housing and urban affairs ministry said during 2023–24 and 2024–25, CPWD procured 300 air purifiers. “The devices were issued to offices, chambers, VVIP lounges, dining halls of judges and registrar of SC, courtrooms, ministers, Constitution Club of India, LS/RS secretariats in Parliament complex and various offices of ministries, departments at Nirman Bhavan, Sewa Bhavan, Vigyan Bhavan, and CPWD offices at Jodhpur and Varanasi,” it said.

title: ‘Jo uchit samjha woh kiya… scared of truth’: Rahul takes jibe at Modi
Fearing ‘unpleasant act’ by oppn, asked PM to skip Lok Sabha: Birla
description: “Had such an unpleasant act happened, then its sight would have torn the country’s democratic traditions to shreds,” Om Birla said amid protests from opposition MPs. PM Modi’s scheduled reply to the Motion of Thanks on the President’s address was called off at last minute on Wednesday due to intense protest from opposition MPs.

title: Uttar Pradesh CM orders State-wide campaign, action against Chinese kite string
description: “Chinese kite string is completely banned and its continued availability is a matter of serious concern. All police officials across the State should launch intensive raid operations,” Mr. Adityanath said

title: Post-facto green nod to 50 projects since 2021: Minister Vardhan Singh
Autonomy pact inked for 6 Nagaland districts
description: As part of the arrangement, there will be devolution of powers relating to 46 subjects to FNTA, which will cover the districts of Tuensang, Mon, Kiphire, Longleng, Noklak and Shamator. The autonomy and greater say will address the long-standing grievances of ENPO over lack of equitable development in eastern Nagaland districts.

title: NCLT recalls order awarding Alchemist to ‘sister concern’
description: The withdrawal of the corporate resolution order by NCLT, a rare occurrence, happened after Enforcement Directorate approached the Delhi bench with evidence of money laundering by the group and how the promoters had allegedly created a front entity with “proceeds of crime”, making it a financial creditor with 97% voting rights to grab the firm under insolvency proceedings.

title: Delhi HC rules prohibition on transfer of medical student to another college invalid
description: A Bench of Chief Justice D.K. Upadhyaya and Justice Tejas Karia said Regulation 18 of the Graduate Medical Education Regulation, 2023 was against the Constitution for being “manifestly unreasonable and arbitrary”.

title: Orissa HC directs to stop movement of illegally raised minerals
description: Odisha government has been directed to file an affidavit on actions taken to contain illegal mining activities within three weeks

title: Unlike in 3 other opposition states, West Bengal sees governor-govt cordiality
description: West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose  read out portions of the address highlighting law and order, including references to Kolkata being among the safest cities in the country. In a rare display of cordiality, he was even seen briefly holding hands and speaking with CM Mamata Banerjee after his address, prompting BJP legislators to sarcastically comment “well done”, as he exited the House.

title: Treat Chinese manjha deaths as murder, CM Yogi orders officials
description: Asked how the directive will be implemented, additional chief secretary (home) Sanjay Prasad said, “We are working on a legal and procedural framework to ensure any death caused due to the use of banned Chinese manjha is treated as a case of murder. Clear instructions will be issued to the police so that strict action can be taken against all those involved in its sale, supply or use.”

title: Manipur erupts over Nemcha Kipgen as new deputy CM
description: ​​The influential Kuki Zo Council declared a social boycott of any legislator from the community joining CM Yumnam Khemchand Singh’s govt. Protesters burned tyres and blocked roads in Kangpokpi district, and at least one group called for a shutdown in the hills. In Kangpokpi, roads littered with burning tyres signalled a return to unrest after a period of relative calm across the hills.

title: SC upholds HC order cancelling allotment  of land to mediation centre in Hyderabad
India, GCC ink terms of reference to formally launch trade talks
Critical minerals cooperation with US advancing rapidly: Jaishankar
description: According to the MEA, Jaishankar, in the meeting, highlighted the challenges of excessive concentration and the importance of de-risking supply, and also spoke about structured international cooperation. Jaishankar said on X that the deal opens up a new phase in India-US bilateral ties, with vast possibilities for the relationship, signalling renewed high-level engagements in the next few months.

title: Didi’s poll sop: Stipend for jobless youth, hike in payout to women
description: Finance minister Chandrima Bhattacharya on Thursday had some cheer for state govt employees too, budgeting for a 4% hike in DA. Govt rechristened its Karmashree scheme as “Mahatma Shree” and hiked the minimum number of workdays from 75 to 100 in what is being seen as a nod to Trinamool Congress’s opposition to the Centre’s decision to replace MGNREGA.

title: Rs 3,200 crore stuck in Northeast projects; Assam tops unpaid list
description: State-wise figures show Assam topping the list with Rs 1,012.87 crore pending across 35 projects, followed by Manipur (Rs 441.38 crore), Nagaland (Rs 406.09 crore) and Arunachal Pradesh (Rs 395.37 crore). Other states with large unpaid amounts include Tripura (Rs 308.71 crore), Mizoram (Rs 275.81 crore), Meghalaya (Rs 258.05 crore) and Sikkim (Rs 107.90 crore).

title: Joint statement on US trade deal soon, pact may be signed mid-March: Goyal
description: ​Their tariffs are executive tariffs. Our tariffs are MFN tariffs (rates applicable to countries with which concessional or FTA rates have not been worked out). So MFN tariff reduction can only take place after the legal agreement is signed, but we hope to do it fast,” commerce secretary Rajesh Agrawal said.

title: TRAI issues Telecommunication (Broadcasting and Cable) Services Interconnection (Addressable Systems) (Seventh Amendment) Regulations, 2026
description: Clearly defined timelines for audits; Audit is to be done on financial year basis in place of calendar year; and Broadcasters can depute their representative during audit to ensure transparency and credibility of the audit process, among the main features of the regulations

title: Open to exploring oil supplies from Venezuela: Govt
description: “Consistent with India’s approach to energy security, India remains open to exploring the commercial merits of any new crude supply options, including from Venezuela,” said the official. On India’s energy sourcing, the official recalled that govt had stated publicly on several occasions that ensuring the energy security of 1.4 billion Indians was the supreme priority of govt.

title: In Rajya Sabha, Kharge refers to LS row, draws BJP fire
description: Kharge’s reference to LS proceedings drew a sharp response from BJP, with Leader of the House in RS JP Nadda mocking Rahul as “abodh balak (ignorant child)” and reminding Kharge that events of one House cannot be debated in another. Nadda asked Kharge not to let Congress become “hostage” to Rahul and said arrogance and ignorance should not dictate actions.

title: FIR over scuffle in BHU campus as UGC issue take centre stage
description: A physical altercation at Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on February 3, 2026, occurred after M.A. History student Adarsh Kumar reported being attacked for sharing a protest poster on new UGC regulations. While the FIR does not explicitly connect the violence to the UGC issue, he claims it stemmed from a WhatsApp debate on the topic

title: Police can’t arrest an accused simply to ask questions: Supreme Court
description: Enumerating various sections of the newly enacted Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023, a bench of Justices M M Sundresh and N K Singh said a notice under Section 35(3) of the law to an accused or any individual concerned, qua offences punishable with imprisonment of up to 7 years, is the rule.

title: Deals with EU, US good sign for world stability: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha
description: PM Modi’s remarks in Rajya Sabha, during the debate on the motion of thanks on the President’s address, came even as the treaty with the US is yet to be formally signed. It’s being seen as an indication that the two sides may have resolved their differences. The formal announcement of the deal is likely next week.

title: UT with Assembly model should be done away with from Constitution: J&K CM Omar Abdullah
description: “It’s very hard to work as CM of a UT with Assembly. I appeal to the Prime Minister to as a gift to this nation abolish this system from the Constitution. Either it should be a State or a UT without Assembly. It’s like tying the hand of government from behind and is a fraud with the mandate of people,” said Mr. Abdullah

title: IndiGo’s December disruption stranded 16.2 lakh domestic flyers: DGCA
description: The directorate’s monthly traffic data for Dec 2025 says 16.2 lakh domestic flyers were stranded at airports across the country due to the non-availability of either IndiGo aircraft or their crew members. The number of people affected due to total cancellation of flights was 9.8 lakh, while those stranded at the airports due to delays beyond two hours were 6.4 lakh.

title: 5 LCA Mk1A fighter jets fully ready for delivery to IAF: HAL
description: HAL said that “an additional nine aircraft have already been built and flown. Upon receipt of engines from General Electric (US company), these aircraft will be made ready for delivery”. “All design and development issues identified are being addressed in an expedited manner. HAL is in active discussions with IAF to deliver the aircraft at the earliest,” it said in a statement.

title: Congress appoints former CM Okram Ibobi Singh as its Manipur unit chief
description: The party appointed Meghachandra as the new Congress Legislature Party Leader with K. Ranjit Singh as his deputy

title: Amit Shah embarks on two-day J&K visit
description: Senior Congress leader and legislator Tariq Hameed Karra said frequent visits by Amit Shah were “an indication of the fact that things were not normal in J&K”

title: India import of Russian crude in December lowest since February 2025
description: The US had announced sanctions on the two companies on Oct 22 and set Nov 21 as the deadline for all dealings with them to be wound down. As per data shared by the ministry of commerce and industry, Dec supplies of Russian oil were nearly 27% lower compared with imports worth $3.7 billion a month earlier in Nov 2025, and over 15% lower than the $3.2 billion imported during the corresponding month in 2024.

title: Married woman can’t claim rape on false marriage promise: Supreme Court
description: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said in such cases, a woman was not eligible to get married due to the subsistence of her marriage and she could not invoke the ground of false promise of marriage. It passed the order while quashing criminal proceedings against a lawyer on a complaint filed by a woman advocate alleging that he had raped her on the false promise of marriage.

title: Honoured to carry Olympic flame at Winter Olympics: Bindra
description: “Honoured to carry the Olympic flame at @milanocortina26. A symbol of unity, perseverance, and shared human aspiration,” Bindra wrote on ‘X’ along with a few pictures taken on a rainy day

title: A time for reflection
BOXAM Elite 2026: Lovlina starts with win, Hitesh marches on
description: In the women’s 75kg category, Lovlina pips Ukraine’s Olha Pylypchuk 5:0; In the men’s 70kg section, Hitesh wins Canada’s Vincent Santoriello 5:0

title: Hockey India names 24-member squad for Pro League
description: While Pawan Malik gets a chance in the goal, defender and drag-flicker Amandeep Lakra has earned a call-up after an impressive outing in the Hockey India League, where he was adjudged the Player of the Tournament.

title: Four-star Kerala demolishes Punjab, sets up summit clash with Services
description: Riyas stars with a brace for the seven-time champion while Ajsal and Viknesh score one apiece; Harjit being sent off in the 72nd minute compounds the opponent’s woes: Abhishek’s double seals the fate of Railways in the first last-four encounter; final to be played on Sunday

title: Should the Governor’s address be scrapped?
Celina Jaitly seeks PM Modi’s help for brother Vikrant Kumar Jaitly detained in UAE
description: Celina Jaitly has appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene in the case of her brother, Major Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, a former Indian Army Special Forces officer who has been detained in the United Arab Emirates since September 2024. Speaking to India Today, Celina broke down while recounting what she described as an unlawful and opaque detention that has stretched on for over 16 months.

title: Bulls vs Raptors injury report: Who’s out, questionable, and starting Feb 5
description: Chicago Bulls and Toronto Raptors clash Thursday, both battling for Eastern Conference playoff spots amidst significant roster disruptions.  With key players sidelined due to trades and injuries, this game hinges on depth, rebounding, and guard play. The Bulls have dominated the season series, but Toronto's defense aims to challenge Chicago's depleted lineup.

title: MPs join call for reinstatementof rusticated JNU students
Ghaziabad girls’ death: polygamous familyset-up under scanner
LIC eyes higher yields from real estate
description: Addressing a press conference after the board meeting, the corporation’s MD & CEO R Doraiswamy said LIC has decided to go slow on its earlier announced plan of entering the health insurance business, which was announced by his predecessor. For the quarter ended Dec 2025, the corporation reported standalone net profit of Rs 12,958 crore, up 17.2% from Rs 11,056 crore in the corresponding year-ago period.

title: The free press dies in broad daylight
description: The fate of The Washington Post serves as a cautionary tale

title: He always wanted us to attack: Shanaka on Rathour
description: “Vikram Rathour being a good addition to our side,” Shanaka said while addressing a captains’ day event alongside seven other skippers from participating teams

title: NHL prospect Gavin McKenna released on $20K bail after felony assault
description: Penn State forward and top 2026 NHL draft prospect Gavin McKenna was arrested on felony assault charges following an altercation near campus. McKenna, facing aggravated assault and other charges, was released on $20,000 bail. The incident reportedly involved McKenna punching a victim, causing facial injuries requiring surgery.

title: Plastic waste major challenge in making Delhi clean: CM
‘I have no clue about this’: Anurag Kashyap on being named in Epstein files, says it’s ‘some random email’
Delhi HC directs CBSE to rectify subject discrepancies of Class 12 students
Tyler Shough named NFL Rookie of the Year after standout Saints season
description: New Orleans Saints quarterback Tyler Shough has earned the Pepsi Zero Sugar NFL Rookie of the Year award. Stepping in mid-season, he revitalized the Saints' campaign, leading them to a winning record in their final nine games.

title: Two arrested for writing pro-Khalistan slogans ahead of R-Day
Reduction in air pollution isn’t a victory, but a positive sign
description: Development and employment in NCR, home to eight crore people, must be balanced with the need for clean air, says Central pollution panel official Tarun Kumar Pithode

title: Fifty years ago | Harold Macmillan to visit Madras
A hundred years ago | Control of Buddha Gaya
India, six Gulf nations set stage to launch FTA talks
description: Gulf Cooperation Council  — comprising Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and UAE — is a key trade and investment partner for India, with exports of nearly $57 billion and imports of around $122 billion, accounting for over 15% of India’s total global trade. Trade with GCC has grown at an average annual rate of about 15% in the last five years.

title: The fading of India’s environmental jurisprudence
description: The higher judiciary appears to be aiding a watering down of environmental protection

title: SC tells Bengal govt. to pay 25% DA by March 31
description: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari called court verdict a ‘defeat’ for Mamata Banerjee and ‘major win’ for government employees

title: Scientific outlook can pave the way for a developed India: A.S.Kiran Kumar
SIMS Hospital strengthens partnership with Seychelles
Samsung Innovation Campus certifies 2,000 youth in Karnataka
description: 1,100 students certified in Artificial Intelligence and 900 in Coding & Programming

title: CM Stalin inaugurates city’s second pedestrian plaza on Khader Nawaz Khan Road
description: The GCC implemented the project at ₹19.81 cr. The plaza in Nungambakkam features play areas and walkway for persons with disabilities. Shop owners expect the number of visitors to increase

title: Habitual offenders in North-East Bengaluru to be placed under surveillance: DCP
Opposition slams Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister’s remarks on North Indian migrant workers
description: ‘North Indians come to Tamil Nadu only to sell panipuri, work in construction (sector), and wipe tables’, says Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam; AIADMK, BJP slam Minister; DMK defends him

title: India must scale up non-animal methods for pre-clinical drug testing, say experts
We've been able to build depth in squad: Australia captain Marsh on absence of Cummins, Hazlewood
description: Cummins was ruled out of the marquee event with a back strain and Hazlewood will miss a couple of matches in the group phase because of an Achilles niggle

title: Foundation stone laid for ₹310-crore Guindy-Velachery flyover
Department of Posts to introduce 24-hour, 48-hour speed post services in Chennai this month
India game not in our control, it's government's decision: Pakistan skipper Salman Agha
description: Salman Agha said in the event of India and Pakistan clashing in the knockouts, his team will again abide by the decision taken by the Pakistan government

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo addresses trade rumors in blunt Instagram post
description: Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo addressed trade rumors via an Instagram story, reassuring fans of his commitment to the team. Despite recent injuries, his consistent scoring has fueled speculation, but Antetokounmpo has repeatedly stated his desire to remain with the Bucks, pledging his loyalty and expressing his intent to compete with his current team.

title: BBC-1 to be completed over next year and a half: DKS
AIADMK announces stir against DMK government’s move on new rural job guarantee scheme
Two persons arrested for throwing country-made bombs into house in Maduravoyal
T.N.’s first glow garden opens at Mamallapuram
description: An amphitheatre, food kiosks, selfie points, walkways lined with artificial trees, plants and flowers, and seats that light up are among the features of the garden that has come up on TTDC land

title: I wanted a new challenge and a new opportunity to make an impact in a new league: David Harte
description: The Irish shot-stopper, who rates Tamil Nadu Dragons teammate Prince Deep highly, talks about the evolution of goalkeeping, the value of experience and enjoying the pressure moments

title: Supreme Court relief to T.N. in case of Vice-Chancellors’ appointments historically significant: Higher Education Minister
Intel signals GPU push as CEO sends message to Nvidia’s Huang
description: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announced the company's entry into the graphics processing unit (GPU) market, hiring a chief GPU architect to develop chips for data centers. This move challenges Nvidia's dominance in AI hardware, as Intel aims to address the growing demand for AI infrastructure and overcome recent CPU supply misjudgments.

title: Gururaja Poojari wins gold in Elite 60kg event
Woman rowdy sheeter arrested under KCOCA in kidnapping case
TMC govt. hikes monthly aid for women, unveils scheme for unemployed
description: ₹4.06-lakh-crore interim budget tabled ahead of West Bengal Assembly election; under ‘Banglar Yuba Sathi’, monthly allowance of ₹1,500 will be given to jobless youth; BJP terms it a ‘deception’

title: Feminichi Fatima to open 81st Rasmi film festival on February 6
Maoist killed, C-60 commando injured in encounter in Gadchiroli; two Maoist camps destroyed
description: The operation involving 14 C-60 units under SDPO Bhamragd began near Phodewada village on Gadchiroli-Narayanpur border after specific intelligence was received on Tuesday (February 3, 2026) evening about the presence of ultras of company number 10 of the outlawed Communist Party of India (Maoist), an official said

title: WPL 2026: Smriti Mandhana, Georgia Voll deny Delhi yet again with masterful chase for RCB’s second title
T.N. should pursue project to link Godavari and Cauvery to address water needs: VIT Chancellor
Mobile phone ban in Himachal Pradesh schools from March 1
Global seminar on fireflies concludes
Farmers stage protest against India-U.S. trade deal across Punjab
Doctors use translation tools to bridge language barrier to treat Syrian patients at Jayadeva Institute
More money for defence, now fix the process
description: A defence Budget has to be seen as tool that powers growth

title: New headquarters for Kerala Media Academy at Kakkanad
​Intent and outcome: On India’s climate budget for 2026-27

title: Pir Panjal division demand a ‘Greater Kashmir conspiracy’? BJP MLA roils J&K assembly

The region refers to the mountainous belt along the Pir Panjal range south of Kashmir valley and close to the LoC.

description: Govt also sought clarity on the financial burden of granting Ladakh full statehood with a legislature, including salaries, provident fund liabilities and other expenditures for about 19,000 employees. description: ​PM Narendra Modi condoled the loss of lives in the the mishap and announced an ex gratia of Rs 2 lakh from PMNRF for the next of kin of each deceased and Rs 50,000 to the injured. According to a PTI report, DGP I Nongrang has confirmed recovery of 16 bodies so far. “The exact number of labourers present inside the mine at the time of the explosion is yet to be ascertained. More people are feared trapped,” she said.

title: Infertility in India: bringing mental health to the forefront
description: Mental health is not a peripheral concern in fertility care; it is a central determinant of reproductive health. Until it is treated as an integral component of fertility care for all genders, the science will continue to outpace the social narratives that shape people’s lives

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia's Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown.  Anthropic's new tools, particularly for legal tasks, triggered significant stock drops.  Pichai views AI as an enabling tool, while Huang argues it will enhance, not replace, existing software, urging a focus on core competencies.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'Death better than beatings', daughters wrote in diary
description: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after falling from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad apartment building. A neighbor witnessed the eldest sister on the window ledge with the younger two holding her, before they all fell. Police are investigating, with a diary and mobile phone recovered from the puja room.

title: OpenAI sees exit of senior-level employees after CEO makes it compulsory to use ChatGPT
description: OpenAI is experiencing a significant exodus of senior researchers as CEO Sam Altman prioritizes ChatGPT development over long-term AI exploration.  Key figures, including a VP of research, have departed due to resource allocation disputes, with experimental projects reportedly sidelined.  This strategic shift, driven by intense competition, leaves some teams feeling marginalized and questioning their original research goals.

title: Rediscovering the virtues of bamboo, an ancient plant
description: Bamboo trees across the country are best planted and grown in tropical and humid conditions, with good sunlight exposure and soil rich in organic matter

title: Loud music may damage your hearing before you realise it
description: Research has shown that prolonged exposure to loud noise can damage synapses without affecting the hearing threshold; since clinical assessments bank on this threshold, a normal audiogram need not mean no hearing damage
